intro: Calyptranthes pohliana, commonly known as the Hawaiian calyptranthes, is a flowering plant native to the island of Molokai in Hawaii. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom throughout the year. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas within native forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
